title: Regulating Electrode/Electrolyte Interfacial Chemistry Enables 4.6 V Ultra-Stable Fast Charging of Commercial LiCoO2
content:
Energy Environ. Sci., 2024, Accepted Manuscript
DOI: 10.1039/D4EE00676C, Paper
Open Access
  This article is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial 3.0 Unported Licence.
Zhong-Shuai Wu, Anping Zhang, Zhihong Bi, gongrui Wang, shihao Liao, Pratteek Das, Hu Lin, Mingrun Li, Yan Yu, Xinliang Feng, Xinhe Bao
The difficulty of achieving fast-charging high-voltage lithium-ion batteries arises from severely unstable electrolyte-electrolyte interfaces with sluggish kinetics. Here we overcome this challenge by developing a “cocktail electrolyte” enabling commercial LiCoO2...
